action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a shelf, a side table, a chair and a book. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book.
You can't see a table here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
Livingroom is not an entity. (this should not occur.)
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate, a cupboard and a table. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate and a book.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a shelf, a side table and a chair. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a living room, a kitchen and a broom closet here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a shelf, a side table and a chair. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a bed and a wardrobe. The pillow is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
You can't see a floor here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know what you mean.
You can't see a floor here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know what you mean.
You put the plate on the bed.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a shelf, a side table and a chair. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You can't see a pillow here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a plate, a bed and a wardrobe. The pillow is on the bed. The plate is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
You can't see a table here.
You can't see a side table here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a shelf, a side table and a chair. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You can't see a pillow here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a plate, a bed and a wardrobe. The pillow is on the bed. The plate is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow and a book.
You can't see a side table here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a shelf, a side table and a chair. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You put the pillow on the side table.
You put the book on the side table.
